hooks.prompt: Check if `.framework-blueprints/00-project-state.json` exists. If it exists, read it and inform the user that a previous framework development session was found, showing the project name, current phase, and last update date. Ask if they want to resume or start fresh. If no state file exists, proceed normally.

If `.framework-blueprints/00-project-state.json` exists, briefly check that this request aligns with the current phase and doesn't conflict with existing decisions. If major conflict detected, warn the user.
Before writing code that may call API endpoints, verify the endpoint exists in `.framework-blueprints/03-api-planning/api-contracts.md` if that file exists. Use only endpoints defined there.
If a file in `.framework-blueprints/` was modified, consider updating `00-project-state.json` with the change and timestamp.
If working on framework development and significant progress was made, remind user they can run `/checkpoint` to save state, or suggest committing blueprint changes with git.
